member_organisations: The complete list of our member organisations can be found at www.magazinemedia.eu. There are three categories of membership: Corporate Members, International and National Associations, and Strategic Partners.
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: The main files covered by EMMA include such topics as: data protection, copyright, competition, VAT, media pluralism, media freedom, privacy, and postal usage.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

goals__remit:
The European Magazine Media Association, EMMA, is a non-profit organization based in Brussels. This European umbrella association represents towards the Institutions of the Europe Union the interests of the different national associations of magazine media in Europe, as well as a number of corporate members.  
 
EMMA’s mission is to promote and protect the interests of publishers of magazine media within the European Union, thus ensuring the long-term survival and prosperity of a plural, diverse and economically successful magazine media in the EU. In this logic, EMMA defends the freedom of expression, thus promoting pluralism and diversity, and make certain that Europe’s magazine media sector remains competitive and vibrant.
relevant_communication: EMMA is the host of the think tank initiative, the Future Media Lab. Via this platform, a number of events, projects and publications are organised. More information can be found on the Future Media Lab. website: www.futuremedialab.info.
